title: Chohan's England debt to South Asian Cricket Academy
description: Yorkshire leg-spinner Jafer Chohan says he "might not" have been in the England squad if it wasn't for the South Asian Cricket Academy (SACA).
excerpt: Yorkshire leg-spinner Jafer Chohan says he "might not" have been in the England squad if it wasn't for the South Asian Cricket Academy (SACA).
text: Yorkshire leg-spinner Jafer Chohan says he "might not" have been called up by England if it wasn't for the South Asian Cricket Academy (SACA).He was among three uncapped players named in England's white-ball senior squad to face West Indies in a tour that starts later this month, and he will later tour South Africa with England Lions.Chohan is poised to be the first graduate from the SACA to play for England. The SACA is an academy aimed at increasing British South Asian representation in professional cricket.READ MORE: Chohan among six newcomers in England Lions squad
html:
Yorkshire leg-spinner Jafer Chohan says he "might not" have been called up by England if it wasn't for the South Asian Cricket Academy (SACA).

He was among three uncapped players named in England's white-ball senior squad to face West Indies in a tour that starts later this month, and he will later tour South Africa with England Lions.

Chohan is poised to be the first graduate from the SACA to play for England. The SACA is an academy aimed at increasing British South Asian representation in professional cricket.

READ MORE: Chohan among six newcomers in England Lions squad
